website_summaries.verdict: Impressively accurate shot and an even more impressive price.
pros: The Beeman is lightweight and easy to handle
The safety kicks in after each pump
The gun has an accurate shot and quality trigger pull
The single pump is simple and doesn't require much strength
The fiber optic sights work well
The low price point is desirable as well
cons: The gun produces a loud crack when firing that may be disruptive

customer_reviews.title: some poor design factors
customer_reviews.text: #1 = they say NOT TO push on the rear sight to close the chamber. that makes sense but is VERY HARD TO DO. my older kids and wife CANNOT CLOSE IT PERIOD. the pressure is hi, gun shoots great. but closing it especially hard and if you hold it short of the sight even harder, (it makes sense so you don't mess with you sight settings ) #2 almost as bad .... the loading as many say is very inconvenient.. they say you get used to it but the manufacturer could very easily make that much more simple.. The looks and shooting/trigger for a 25.00 pellet pistol is great. I'm going to work on a loading tube for it.
customer_reviews.author: G.P.WI

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great target pellet gun. You can hit cans at 30ft right out of the package. It takes some effort to function but The trigger is great and is adjustable. Update! My son loves this pellet pistol but it was to hard for him operate. So what I did was drill a hole in the face of the piston with a small! small! step drill. Untill he could operate it. This drops the compression down and also lowers the power of the gun. But it's just for paper so we aren't worried about. It's easy to operate now and is a great trainer with a good trigger for smaller beginner shooters.
customer_reviews.author: Thomasajimenez1980

customer_reviews.title: Was great for about 30 rounds or so before it broke
customer_reviews.text: Was great for about 30 rounds or so before it broke, just after loading it became routine. Disappointed, piece of garbage low quality control! Returning.
customer_reviews.author: ELP

customer_reviews.title: The Dread of backyard rodents near and far
customer_reviews.text: If you need something that will take out a rat, but not wake up the neighbors, look no further. It almost seems broken at first because it is so quiet, but critters know it's not broken. Have only needed one shot every time and I've been a rat stackin fool lately. I have tried it at distance and it was pretty accurate without being sighted. I'm quite certain that there are more accurate things out there but it's 34 bucks for chrizakes. Smoking deal for such a tool.
customer_reviews.author: Big River

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly heavy and good quality. It's not like a real gun, but much better than airsoft guns or most other air rifles or pistols at this price. It shot dead on and there aren't any parts that I am worried about failing anytime soon. I'll update the review if anything happens to it within the first six months. At first it was difficult to open it to insert the pellet, but after about 20 times it opens very easily. It takes a bit of pressure to close it, but not an incredible amount. Any teenager or higher should have no trouble, and it's much more convenient than having to pump a rife many times.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money; accuracy is decent; it can be tuned up.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for the money. Decent accuracy and OK range. Rifled single shot pellet. Do check on YT for "tighten this and that" vids as various screws may be loose. I also highly recommend scrubbing out any new air rifle barrel with JB bore paste. Really helps clean it out (lots of factory crud in even expensive air rifles out of the box) and polishes it up some. Note this is a "cheap Chinese clone" of the far fancier and far higher quality German version of the same pistol. But for plinking it can't be beat. I sent one to each of my brothers (Xmas deal) and kept one for myself. What a stocking stuffer eh?
customer_reviews.author: MH.

customer_reviews.title: Great in a few ways, bad in a few ways
customer_reviews.text: These guns have a great trigger, and so they are accurate... 2 things that ruin this gun, and the reason I gave it to my neighbor..#1.. Very hard to cock, I will assure you will get your shirt caught in it, or even worse, pinch yourself.. # 2 Very difficult to load a pellet into, I have challenged people on air gun sites, to post videos of them cocking and loading these, and nobody will do it...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Defective and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I liked this until a very important set screw came loose creating a very dangerous situation. I used 3 times and shot 5 pellets, this came from the factory like this. So, beware. Not worth shipping back, cost and time, But wanted to let people know, before someone gets injured.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Great way to improve your shooting skills.
customer_reviews.text: Picked a few if these up during sale, kept one for myself and gave a few to friends. I am super impressed at how accurate this thing is. Dime sized shot groups are the norm. Took a bit of sight adjustment but well worth the time. Surprisingly powerful as well. This is a lot of fun for inexpensive plinking. It will help make you a better shot at a much lower cost than firing traditional ammo.
customer_reviews.author: Michael I.

customer_reviews.title: $30 tack driver
customer_reviews.text: The Beeman P17 (2004) is a $30 tack driver at 10-25 yds...once you put a red dot on it. The factory sights make it hard for precise repetitive shooting but man oh man is this thing fun!!! I put a rail and red dot on mine and very pleased with the results. I recommend taking the main piston out to clean and relube and checking for burrs on the air intake hole (may require some sanding with superfine sand paper (check out some YouTube videos on how to do this). All in all, very pleased with my set up. The pics with the cans or pellet tins are 25 yd shots. Everything else are shots at 10 yds
customer_reviews.author: Donald Thomas

customer_reviews.title: The barrel was pointing unacceptably to the right due to poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.text: The polymer upper receiver barrel hole was drilled pitifully off center, resulting in a pathetically misaligned pistol. I adjusted the rear sight about twenty clicks to the left before giving up and finding the problem, which could not be repaired. I will not risk another poorly executed copy.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but no oomph
customer_reviews.text: This air pistol was accurate right out of the box. I could hit a small water bottle or a pine cone dead center from 5-10m, no problem. But it doesn't have the oomph to puncture the small flimsy water bottle - the cheap kind you get for free at events. Barely a dent. Half full of water, didn't even knock it down. Nor the oomph to knock a fist-sized pine cone off a log, even at point blank range. The cone just rocked a bit so I knew I hit it, but it didn't knock it off the log.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ware

customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. The first one had a great trigger. The second one has a trigger that is a bad as the first one was good. Both are accurate enough to hit air gun silhouettes at the proper ranges. I'm still using both, but the second is MUCH harder to hit with due to the super creepy and gritty trigger. Worth the money? YES. A lot of nerf guns cost more and these will shoot dime size groups at 10meters outdoors. Not bad. Just hope you get lucky in the trigger dept.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hankins

customer_reviews.title: Hard to cock.
customer_reviews.text: Great little pistol for the money. I use it for keeping the squirrels off my bird feeders. Powerful enough to be a great deterrent, but not so powerful as to kill them. Robust single cock pneumatic system. Not for kids or most women. Single shot, pellets only. The gun will hold pressure for days without losing power. The safety lever is a bit awkward, but works just fine. The adjustable sight screws are really too easily moved if bumped even slightly, but hold true if you're careful with them.
customer_reviews.author: Flippin Hippie

customer_reviews.title: He's retired and bored LOL Anyway
customer_reviews.text: My silly dad asked for a pellet gun for his 64th birthday. He's retired and bored LOL Anyway, 3 of us ended up getting him pellet guns and this one has been his favorite so far overall. His only complaint was how long it takes to load and how strong you need to be. But performance is outstanding. If you're buying this for someone who may have arthritis, RA, very young or very old you may want to consider other options. You need to be pretty strong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sportolos1

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have Beeman air gun rifle and I am very pleased with all aspects. However, this air pistol falls way short of their product performance. Looked descent but probably couldn't pop a balloon. Should have know better as the price is cheap just as the product is. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mose

customer_reviews.title: Great fun & quality for this little price.
customer_reviews.text: I have several airguns, this one rocks! Within 10 shots with open sights I was hitting 1" at 15yds. Too much fun with this!! I REALLY suggest the Air Ventur pellet pen or needle nose plyers. The loading breech is a bear to get pellets into. Once I got the pen and added a laser, I am having WAY TOO MUCH fun with this. For this price plus $7-$8 for the pellet pen, rediculous not to have one. WHEEEE!
customer_reviews.author: Jason D

customer_reviews.title: Weak, So Weak
customer_reviews.text: This is such a waste of time and materials. This "gun" fires a puff of air so weak it can't hurt a fly at three inches. That's really close, folks. Gas alone, CO2 pistols blow insects to pieces at that range. (I'm just using this as an example, not to be inhumane.) All this "gun" does is make a light "snap" sound; the pellets it "fires" barely go 40 feet. If you want an air pistol, either get one of the CO2 variants or move up to an air rifle. A pile of dead crabs is more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Il Dottore

customer_reviews.title: THE Best Deal in Air Pistols
customer_reviews.text: This gun is ridiculously affordable for what it is (since it is a copy of the $240 Beeman P3). Eventually, these guns may develop valve leaks, but I've read that an application of Buzzy's Slick Honey silicon grease in the right spots fixes the problem. There are disassembly/reassembly instructions online at [...] Shipping was faster than expected. Once you get used to the moderately heavy one-pump, the gun is very easy to shoot. No recoil, decent power (400 fps with a 7.9 grain Crosman Premier Hollow Point pellet), light, predictable trigger, and superb accuracy are the main traits of this airgun. It is very light and can be shot comfortably with one hand. Probably THE best deal in air pistols.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Rosenfield

customer_reviews.title: nice air gun
customer_reviews.text: Nice airgun for the money. I got it for just over $20 with my Amazon rewards points and I'll have to say,its a great shooter. Plenty accurate and VERY easy to operate. Dont hesitate to buy if you are interested in one. Some people have trouble loading and closing the action but I found it to be no trouble at all. Just need a tiny bit of arm strength and your good to go. Quiet enough for back yard plinking (as long as your neighbors are cool) but don't think you'll hunt with this thing. Not quite enough power for anything bigger than a mouse but beer cans don't stand a chance. Lots of fun especially for $20.
customer_reviews.author: chris merschdorf

customer_reviews.title: This Pistol Is Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I use this shooting 10 yard matches at out club. I have won the last 3 matches. My competition shoots PCP, CO2, some of which are over $400 guns. All I can say is it's the most accurate gun for the dollars spent in my whole arsenal. I found that it likes most pellets, but high quality 7.0 gr wads shoot the best. When I rest this gun, I can get 1/2" groups at 10 yards. IMPORTANT: clean the barrel with solvent when you get it - it has oil and debris from manufacturing it will not group well until it is clean!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: idiotic design I have ever seen in my 50+ years ...
customer_reviews.text: The loading system is THE most bassackwards, most difficult, idiotic design I have ever seen in my 50+ years of sport and target shooting. Extremely hard to push the cocking mechanism back into place; little to no room for loading the pellet. Accuracy is not an issue if you can't load and cock the pistol. It seems just plain stupid to have to invent a loading tool to compensate for an obviously design flaw. Complete 2 thumbs down on this one.
customer_reviews.author: RMO52

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pellet pistol that I have had. I am an experienced competition shooter, and after adjusting the sights i found it very accurate for the price paid. Before shooting it I ran a dry patch through the barrel and added some white lithium grease to the piston like recommended in the manual. Loading the pellets can a bit tricky with my large hands, and closing the top to the lock position is some what hard. I wear a glove on my left hand due to some sharp edges on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Good value,good pellet gun,just way too hard to close.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that I cannot load and close the gun,I will never be able to,my husband has to do it.I should have researched these guns a little better,also dislike the fact that you can only load one pellet at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Very good air pistol for the value
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and accurate with acceptable power makes it a great value for the price. Very addictive to use with a very good balanced weight with almost no recoil. The only downside is that there is only 1 dove tail rail on the top side which if an optic is placed will make cocking process less comfortable, I wish if there is an under barrel rail to allow installing an under barrel laser and the safety mechanism is not ambidextrous (that's only why I took 1 star off)
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your money.
customer_reviews.text: The rear iron sight always loses zero, in fact the adjustment screw fell off and I lost it trying to load the thing. The loading process is weird, it is very under powered. The only thing that I liked about this gun was the trigger, the fiber optics, and the fact that it has zero recoil.
customer_reviews.author: Roman V.

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: This is a great indoor practice pellet pistol. The trigger is really nice, the accuracy at 5 yards is amazing and the size and shape translate to shooting a full size handgun. I have a $400 Gamo rifle that has the worst trigger ever made I think, poor accuracy at any range which renders it useless but this pistol is the opposite. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rudi

customer_reviews.title: No bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Does not fire anywhere near 410 fps best I could get was 275 does not hold charge for more than 10 minutes after that near zero fps I tested using both H&N Baracuda Green Lead-Free Domed Airgun Pellets .177-Caliber / 6.48 Grains & Daisy Outdoor Products Lead Free .177 Pellets (Silver, 4.5 mm) Cuts through soda cans OK but could not get it to go through a Lipton Diet Green Tea plastic bottle unless I stood less then 5 ft away this will be ok for chasing away small pests from the garden but would not recommend it if you are looking to target shoot anything more then 20 ft away
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Homer

customer_reviews.title: No failures! Works as Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This air pistol works as advertised. It is accurate using Crosman Premier Hollow Point pellets (.177 cal) and took only three shots at 10 yd. to get the sights aligned perfectly on the 10 ring using a pistol bench rest. I recommend this only for adult usage or only to be used under adult supervision. It requires some physical strength to engage the piston and latch, but this has gotten easier as the cocking mechanism (piston/seal) is getting broken in. Also recommend using a pair of tweezers to hold and load the pellets in the breech. Nothing has failed after taking 50 rounds as some people had reported. Yes, I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: I would expect the pellets to pierce through skin no problem. Can keep one loaded without pumping it.
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase for not a lot of money. Very powerful, was able to shoot hard and fast from afar. I would expect the pellets to pierce through skin no problem. What's also nice is I can keep one in the chamber without pumping it, so it's ready to pump and fire quickly. Don't expect to load another one very fast though. I'm a pretty strong guy but this will take two hands and good leveraging to load.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap accurate!
customer_reviews.text: For around $30, this is supposed to be the most accurate air pistol around. Mine has a sweet trigger, nice fiber optic sights, and has been a joy. I use it for indoor target shooting. Keep in mind this is an Adult air pistol and a younger person, even some teens, may struggle with cocking it. Overall a great gun and I have no complaints, a modern classic air pistol!!
customer_reviews.author: Burrito the Night Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Meh, it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful. 410 FPS is highly doubtful. I'd be surprised if the pellet traveled a grand total of 410 feet. It's not very accurate. Shoots off to the right by quite a bit. The rod doesn't always engage when trying to pump it. It takes 1-2 extra tries before it works. Loading it is a pain in the neck if you have large fingers. I have to wiggle the pellet in with one finger. It is fun to goof around with it though. But it's basically a toy.
customer_reviews.author: YelloDog

customer_reviews.title: Solid gun
customer_reviews.text: My first one had a leak in the pressure chamber but the second one works well. It does take some strength to charge the pressure but the weapon is solid enough that it doesn't feel like it's going to break under that much force. For the price it is definitely a good value, although quality can be hit and miss.
customer_reviews.author: Don K

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little pellet gun
customer_reviews.text: Fiber optic sight on mine was kinda broken, I can fix when I have a few minutes. But took it out to the barn and popped off a few pellets, drove pellets into a 2x4 from about 12’ away. Decent power and easy to use. Has good feel and weight seems pretty accurate out of the box. Great for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Rear Sight Failure Immediately Upon Unpackaging
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment to receive a defective product after anticipating it's arrival. Pee-pee poor quality control from factory in China. Based on price and origin, I probably shouldn't be terribly surprised. I am surprised that Beeman would put their name on this product. I am returning immediately for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Le Foxx

customer_reviews.title: Very Realistic!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, as others noted, it is hard to cock. However, the difficulty in loading and cocking become less with practice and proper technique. This air pistol provides a very realistic shooting experience. It is a high quality piece. I have put about 300 pellets through it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Build quality could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice air gun. Fiber optic sights make aiming easy. Loading pellets is a bit tedious if you have large fingers. Trigger action is smooth. Quality could be better. Most of the gun is cast in plastic with go detail, but some areas have excess material left that should have been cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Norm E.

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: A black anodized nut fell out, from someplace, while opening it to load the first time. I hit nothing with it, probably because the pellet fell out while trying to close it, without my realizing. If I don't fire within a couple of minutes, it loses pressure. I spent 99.9% of my time trying to balance the pellet, or looking for one because it fell, either while loading or trying to close without pinching my stomach skin or clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ani Salisbury

customer_reviews.title: Super accurate, NO recoil at all. Best deal ever
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pistol for the price. Have loads of air guns and real guns and this is one of my faves. It's a cheapo version of the P3. Feels great in my hand, and it has absolutely no recoil. Not sure how they do that, but it makes the gun ridiculously accurate. Mine had a messed up rear sight so I got a replacement from Amazon and I'm still giving it 5 stars. The only other one that competes is the crosman 1377 and 1322. This one is hard to cock and hard to load but it feels so good and shoots so smooth I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: printist

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall good pellet gun remember you need pellets not bbs it is kinda hard to pump flip back down. It is single shot, the gun feels heavy in the package but it is very balanced 10/10 would recommend this is a Quality Except for the part of the sight. Be safe and Have fun very realistic
customer_reviews.author: shawn tinsman

customer_reviews.title: Beeman P17
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and accurate. I put the red dot sight and I can hit a quarter and any target in 20 yards 100%. Hit a golf ball in 20 Yards is so easy!!!! I love it. I can compete with anyone use high end air pistal and air rifle in 20 yards competition. Ready for the challenge! Today May 16 2020 mount the laser scope to my Beeman 19. Excellent combo! Shoot beer can at 16 Yards no problem. Enjoy shooting!
customer_reviews.author: tony wang

customer_reviews.title: How can this be so good and so cheap?
customer_reviews.text: This has been a nice target shooting pistol for my garage range. The trigger is really nice for something so inexpensive. Cocking does take some effort, but you get used to it. As expected, wadcutters have been the most accurate. Everyone should have one of these for plinking.
customer_reviews.author: H3H8M3

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Dead on accurate. Not the easiest thing to load if you have large fingers. And I wouldn’t suggest it for small kids, a little difficult to snapshot. Overall love this pistol. Feels great and the hand, sites are easy to see, great trigger break! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kc707

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Really a fun gun to shoot. Good feel in the hand. Solid and well made (in China, of course) German design. Children and ladies may have trouble with the compression cycle on closing. It takes strong hands. It is as accurate as much more expensive pistols, but in the lower power range. Not recommended for hunting, but great for cheaply practicing pistol shooting. For the price it is hard to beat. I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: WJ F

customer_reviews.title: Economical and almost exact copy of the Beeman P3
customer_reviews.text: A great Air Gun Pistol! Economical to shoot: no CO2 cartridges to purchase. A great way to teach firearms safety and marksmanship to youngsters! This gun has an excellent trigger and sights. It takes some effort to cock it, because you have to compress the air in the cylinder, but with practice it gets easier. It is relatively quiet, so one can practice in your backyard, just make sure you have a suitable backstop. It is much less expensive and almost exactly the same as another Beeman Air Gun that sells for around $200.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Tremmel

customer_reviews.title: Love This A.P.
customer_reviews.text: Love this P17. Fantastic air pistol. Incredibly accurate and powerful. The only two negatives for me I have found is with. One: the amount of strength needed & the possibility of loosing a bit of skin whilst resting the air chamber for each shot. With this, I advise on a snug fitting leather glove, at least for the hand used to compress the pneumatic. 2: add a pellet pen to your order. The loading area is very occward. Overall, I give the Beeman Marksman P17 5 Stars. Cheap, fun and fairly quiet. Good job Beeman S.Read
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Whoa!
customer_reviews.text: You gotta have yourself one of these. I just got mine in today and started running a few through it to break it in. I doesn't need it. Within approximately 10-15 rds it's dead on at 10 yds. Big comfortable grip. Easy to load after you fiddle with it a bit. Why can't all airguns have a trigger like this one has, it's nothing like my air rifle triggers, light and breaks clean. Yeah it'll build your arms up cocking it but I need the exercise;). This is a great plinker and a great gift for shooters.
customer_reviews.author: Jawjadawg1950

customer_reviews.title: Insanely accurate for ~$30!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing they could have done better in my opinion was to make the barrel 1" longer. Then it would come flush to the end of the gun, properly. The "diffuser" they created by tucking the barrel in and porting the frame does nothing to help the accuracy of a gun of this power level. But, an inch of barrel could add a smidge more velocity, which is crucial in drag stabilized projectiles -pellets. I mainly use it for plinking and target-which it was designed for and it does this as well as some $200-$400 guns of the same design from other companies. You will never find a more accurate pistol for about $30.
customer_reviews.author: josh m bilger

customer_reviews.title: What a waste
customer_reviews.text: This pellet gun worked for 13 shots before breaking with NO response from seller
customer_reviews.author: Trent Zinser

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pistol, but sometimes requires repair.
customer_reviews.text: This pistol is great fun to shoot: very nice light trigger, nice fiber optic sights, and extremely accurate out to 35 feet. Cocking requires some hand strength: not for kids. I own two of these, and one failed to fire after about 100 shots. I had to take it apart and smooth out several metal trigger parts with emery cloth. Now it shoots reliably again.
customer_reviews.author: Havingfun

customer_reviews.title: Ok for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Air pistol because it looks real and when I pointed who is marine, he got upset as he thought it was real. It has pretty good accuracy. Loading the pellets and closing the gun can be a little struggle but I guess closing it is what traps the air required for firing it. I will buy again if they make a semi automatic with up to 10rounds
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has decent power for an inexpensive pistol that doesn't require C02. It has some heft to it as well. I have dialed the sights in and get decent groups, but it is not as accurate as something nice (like a Marauder). A lot of fun for plinking and shooting cans though. It has a bit of a strange way to load, but I can't think of any other option the designers had. Fun gun with pretty nice sights for the price.
customer_reviews.author: dashreeve

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: I beat around the bush for awhile on this purchase. After having it for a few weeks now it is very fun to shoot, quite accurate with a great sight set up, the fiber optics are good for day time or evening plinking. Once you practice loading its easy. Seems to really like Beeman wadcutter and hollow point coated pellets. Good for 10 yards. Cans and paper targets look out. Fun with Air Ventury metal silhouette targets too.
customer_reviews.author: ez

customer_reviews.title: Curiousity got the best of me.
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and very accurate. I modded it by stippling the grip to make it a little tacky. Not the best looking air pistol but for the price and performance its hard to beat. Best of all, its a single pump pneumatic, no recoil. Satisfied with my purchase .
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to close
customer_reviews.text: The strength required to load it was just too much of an issue. I had to lean over it & use my upper body to also press down when trying to close it. The seller was great though at taking it as a return & issuing my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with accuracy...difficult to load a pellet
customer_reviews.text: This pistol is very accurate, but was difficult to load a pellet with my fingers. I was able to find a cheap pellet pen and then enlarged/drilled the back (plastic) of the pistol near the release 'hammer' so the pen could be inserted directly onto the barrel and loading is now a breeze. Extremely happy with this purchase and the pistol overall. A great way to teach and practice iron sights shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Hagrid

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pellet pistol!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing pellet pistol! The low price just makes it that much better. It is accurate and the one pump is easy to do. Loading the pellet takes some practice but once you get it it’s easy. This thing was strong enough to dispatch squirrels at about 30 yards and an adult possum! Perfect for quiet varmint control.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Target practice gone good
customer_reviews.text: For the price this air pistol is well worth the money, and it out performs a lot of other higher priced pieces I’ve owned . Feels good in your hand , I actually good tired from shooting it so much after I got it in the early part of the day ! I put over 150 rounds through it today . I would recommend this air pistol to eveveryone .
customer_reviews.author: steven marquez

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this gun, I have put 1000s of rounds through mine and still fires like new. I must say and have to agree with others that you WILL be working on this gun at some point, not a big deal especially for me. its just little things adjustments here and there. But if you are not mechanically inclined or hate taking things apart this is probably not the gun for you. If that doesn't bother you, than for the money this is the best single pump air pistol out there.
customer_reviews.author: casey milne

customer_reviews.title: Great pellet pistol. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for price. Have shot 2 different P17’s. Both had very good triggers and were accurate for the price. Does pump a little hard but that’s the only negative. Good mass, similar balance to average plastic frame 9mm
customer_reviews.author: Jjh in WI

customer_reviews.title: it educated me about 1 stroke pistols, they suck
customer_reviews.text: Its a pain for what you have to do every shot. For the money, your getting exactly what your paying for, a lot of people like it. Your not in too deep if you dont like it. I personally would save for a CO2 repeater. You will see when you purchase it, and shoot it repeatedly, it sucks.
customer_reviews.author: L. Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: A Vert misleading product. The way you reload this "Pistol" creates various problems as you have to pull the trigger back and pull the top half off with a clunky bullet system to boot. Would not recommend at all!
customer_reviews.author: Fancy Pants

customer_reviews.title: Way to hard to pump/cock
customer_reviews.text: Way to hard to pump/cock, I'm 63 and it way to hard for me to be able to cock/pump it to even use it. there no way a average women or kid could use it., I bought a pump rifle and this pistol is way harder to pump.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Withey

customer_reviews.title: Surprising quality, power and accuracy (especially for the $!)
customer_reviews.text: Shoots great right out of the box. Ran about 300 shots through it tonight. At $32 on Prime, this is a five star steal. Accurate, surprisingly well built, and fun to shoot. Barrel latch isn't as good as it could be, and things aren't super fine detailed, but I'm pretty picky and this is a fine gun. Honestly I feel the quality is just shocking. Velocity is fine, at 10 meters it seems to flatten 7.9 grain crossman wadcutters and hollow points just fine. Far more power than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Cory B.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty snazzy. PELLETS ONLY. BBs just roll out. Single shot, break open and load from inside - can be difficult for fat fingers. Rear sights adjust. Just enough power for some in close precision practice.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne R. Jorgensen Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first few shots
customer_reviews.text: Shot dead on a 1/4 target at 20 yards Rear sight broke after first few shots. I emailed the company but failed to be a reply. It is supposed to Uber a one year warranty. If they respond and fix this I would easily rate this a 5
customer_reviews.author: Fml84321

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but great quality & accuracy!
customer_reviews.text: Best $30 I ever spent! Great practice for learning the basics for the real thing. VERY affordable to shoot, super accurate. No Co2 crap to deal with, 1 pump & fire! Tons of fun on the cheap, just get 1.....
customer_reviews.author: Lonewolf McQuade

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, great value plinker
customer_reviews.text: Great little single shot plinker, not for pest control. the hammer on the back is to open up the top to load and cock the gun. The trigger isn't the crispest but it's good for it's purpose and price.
customer_reviews.author: B. Burn

customer_reviews.title: Great airgun great price
customer_reviews.text: Great air gun for the money. Accurate, nice sights, and just fun to shoot. Pay attention to the instruction when cocking you can get quite a pinch! And takes a good grip and effort to get it cocked. It also takes a little getting use to getting the pellet in the chamber, it's a little tight if one have big hands. It likes Crosman Premier pellets and shoot at 10 meters without any problem. Hope you have as much fun shooting this pistol as I have.
customer_reviews.author: IMHOGYLD

customer_reviews.title: just what expected a nice packaged well made air pistol that does what it ...
customer_reviews.text: just what expected a nice packaged well made air pistol that does what it says its suppose to .right away it looks very authenthic and the loading is no problem once you cock thehammer releasing wearing you pump and insert pellet in top hole just make sure it is in nice ...then close it and alittle effort is needed but not much .love the sights on this and i saw its accurate and at 20 feet i hit a cigarette pack and its nice for target shooting and it came sooner then i imagined ..thanks amazon ....waiting on a few other things 8]cant wait ..love everything i've purchased and very satisfy ...little pellet gun is worth the money for sure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Took out a rabbit with head shot
customer_reviews.text: This gun it accurate but power lackin tested it on a dead squiril I got with my gamo, This pistol wont even go thru the squirils skin at 8 yards with the crossman pointed pellets, Just bounces off of them. But It is possible to take a rabbit with this in the head I have tested it at 12 yards clean kill Crossman pointed 177 pellets do the job. I don't advise using anything but pointed pellets because this gun does not have any energy to even use hollow points or wadcutters. You just want the most penatration.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Needs a redesign
customer_reviews.text: It's an interesting gun but I hate trying to get a pellet into it's tube, you have to have tiny fingers to put it in the tube when it's open. I really didn't care for that awkwardness of design. Spend to much time trying to get a pellet into the tube and less time shooting it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jabaay

customer_reviews.title: Unable to adjust sights
customer_reviews.text: Vertical adjustment screw was too small for the threaded insert on the gun, so it just freewheeled when adjustment was attempted- this rendered the gun useless. Exchanged for another. I will follow up with an updated rating when the new one arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R. Sparlin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome air pistol!
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd one. My first one lasted a very long time. Beeman makes some very fine air guns. Love the neon sights. Won't go wrong on this one. An exceptional airgun at a great price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Accurate pistol.  High value purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate pistol. A nice way to get trigger time between range sessions. The only thing that has surprised me is how accurate I can be with a pistol, which attests to this pistols consistent power plant (pneumatic) and excellent trigger. This pistol has helped me become more accurate with centerfire pistols as well. The trigger pull is excellent. The closest thing to a shortfall would be to say the trigger pull on this is lighter than a real pistol. It's not a hair-trigger, it's just lighter and smoother than a tuned/polished Glock 5lb trigger.
customer_reviews.author: J. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Well made. I have some difficulty cocking this air ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I have some difficulty cocking this air gun, but expect it to loosen up with use.
customer_reviews.author: MorphMother

customer_reviews.title: Hard Hitting and Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: A single shot springer pistol. Hard to cock and somewhat difficult to load at first. Lives up the very positive reviews I read before purchasing. A fun performer with a red dot sight. .177 pellets only. Inexpensive .177 crosman wadcutters work very well in this pistol. Nice, cold weather gun which doesn't suffer from low temperatures like a CO2 powered pistol would. Looks very good, Had good workmanship and is quite accurate. A lot of value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John Orygun

customer_reviews.title: Handles well and goes far!
customer_reviews.text: Shoots really accurately and it feels really good! It is definitely hard to load but having to push down on a tiny lever. I hope it gets easier over time cause I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Tailoredsuits

customer_reviews.title: great gun
customer_reviews.text: i set a dozen soda cans filled with water on the fence and took 6 shots with the iron sights . pretty good . then i put a red dot scope on it . 5 shots to sight it in at 10 yards or so . it was dead on , this an excellent air gun . i don't think you could hunt with it , but it's a dandy plinker for practicing . the kids may have trouble cocking it . it is really well made . 5 stars .
customer_reviews.author: Disabled Catholic

customer_reviews.title: Great, just great!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Great feel, good weight, good accuracy, great trigger, good sights, but... I have to put it between my legs to close, and getting the pellet into the barrel is challenging. Once I develop some upper arm strength it will be better. It's a lot of fun! And a fantastic price!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice for the price. For being a copy of a German classic, you are still getting a really fun enjoyable accurate little pistol. It's not the best pistol in the world, those go for hundreds of dollars. For less than $40 you can't go wrong. I have a few co2 pistols and a multi pump pneumatic pistol and find myself reaching for the p17 the most frequently for its ease of use and accuracy. Trigger breaks cleanly and has the ability to be dry fired to practice technique. All in all a wonderful little pistol.
customer_reviews.author: Mikec714

customer_reviews.title: loved at first then not so much
customer_reviews.text: I loved this pistol for about 2 months. Great accuracy. however, one night it stopped working. i loaded a pellet and went to shoot and it would not fire. Then i tried to open it and clear the jam. It would not open. 2 months later it is still jammed and we cannot use it. Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Never worked right
customer_reviews.text: I had it for a few weeks, tried to get it to work right. It wouldn't shoot. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: No Range & Difficult to load
customer_reviews.text: Has about the same range as an old single pump Daisy BB rifle... you can sometimes see the pellets before they hit the ground. Difficult to load ammo.
customer_reviews.author: Truckman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent classic pistol
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. No recoil is true. Trigger is a pleasure. Rear adjustable sight a plus. Tons of information on YouTube about this I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Panoussi

customer_reviews.title: Great Value if You Can Cock It.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly accurate and consistent for the price. That said, it will be too difficult for many people to cock, and it is not designed for fast firing. Sights are very nice and highly visible with good contrast. Worth every dime. Not very effective, I don't supposed, at more than 25 yards or thereabouts.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Dave

customer_reviews.title: More effort than it's worth.
customer_reviews.text: It shoots but the cocking effort took the fun out of it for me. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for little money!
customer_reviews.text: Have to keep in mind the incredibly low cost of this pistol. Pros: inexpensive, very nice trigger - relatively light and smooth, quick and cheap to replace O-rings, lots of fun to shoot, middling accuracy, nice sight for the money Cons: much plastic, somewhat hard to pump, breech and piston o-rings can wear easily, lack of aftermarket parts like the Crosman 13xx pistols have available
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only holds one shot at a time
customer_reviews.text: This only holds one shot at a time. You have to reload after every shot. I returned it. Also, it takes 28 lbs of pressure to clise, so it's not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive. Feels solid. Reasonably powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Adult pellet pistol. Kids probably could not even load it. Really difficult to load with large hands too. Only average accuracy. Two inches at 15 feet is the best mine does.
customer_reviews.author: TERRY L FEICHTENBINER

customer_reviews.title: No brainer.
customer_reviews.text: Solid .177 pistol. Decent build quality and accurate. No failures after 2 months and 250 pellets through it. For the money this is a no brainer for anyone plinking in the backyard. Trigger is surprisingly good. Only real gripe is loading the pellets in barrel. It's a pretty confined area for adult fingers, pointed pellets will load the easiest. We've been shooting Gamo pellets and can easily shoot a practice golf ball right off a soda can at 10-15 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: A cheap little airgun that grows on you.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is ugly and top heavy and cheep feeling but it shoots super well and you wont burn through CO2 cartridges or pellets for that matter because it's a break barrel pistol. Yeah, it's kind of an oddball but it's just really basic and functional and accurate. You really can't go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzz

customer_reviews.title: very good product
customer_reviews.text: pros: .it is very powerful. Definitely has big damage for close target. The accuracy is satisfied too. feel like a real gun when i hold it on hand . cons: you have to re-load after each shoot, but i can take it, because it is much cheaper and i don't need buy extra CO2 .
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Totally in love with this little one. It has an incredible level of accuracy. It is a bit complicated at the time of loading but, beside that detail, it is amazing. I recommend it for any begginer who want to practice or improve their shooting skills
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: small fingers work better. there needs to be a better way to ...
customer_reviews.text: this gun kicks ass, goes threw 5 pieces of cardboard and rests in the 6 piece. The one thing that's extremely difficult to do is load it, it's very hard to put the pellet in the hole that's tucked in the casing. Unless you have your kid load it, small fingers work better. there needs to be a better way to load this gun. If there was a better way, It would definitely be a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: weed wacker

customer_reviews.title: Only received target and pellets
customer_reviews.text: Reached out to seller since I only received the pellets and target. Both came in the same box, but there was NO pistol. Hopefully I can increase review rating, once resolved.
customer_reviews.author: SY29

customer_reviews.title: sweet pellet  pistol
customer_reviews.text: nice pellet pistol. It is accurate and a great value. Pellets are kind of hard to load due to my sausage fingers a pair of forceps makes it a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: Great accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a fun gun to shoot. It's a little difficult to load, and cocking it can be a bit of a challenge. But even with that I love this gun. Dead on the first shot.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Hand gets pinched cocking.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this purchase but it takes a lot of effort to cock it and it is very easy to get your hand pinched in the process so my advice is to wear a tough well insulated mitten like one made by Carhartt on your cocking hand so it can't get caught between the cocking lever and the gun.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  B

customer_reviews.title: Power and performance all day everyday
customer_reviews.text: Great gun. I had the original back in 2004. This is a better, lighter more ergonomic piece. The sights were 90% zeroed in out the box and the gun was performing at optimum level after an hr of sending lead wad cutters down range. This is more fun and reliable than a c02 pistol. And after a cpl hrs u get used to loading. I like the fiber optic sights. And only had to adjust the wind age to zero in.
customer_reviews.author: amazon addict

product_meta.title: Beeman Sportsman Series Deluxe Air Pistol - Model 2004
feature_bullets: CALIBER: .177 Pellet; VELOCITY: 410 FPS; Single Shot High Precision
WEIGHT: 1.7 lbs.; OVERALL LENGTH: 9.5", BARREL LENGTH: 4.5"
PUMPS: Single Pump (Recoilless); ACTION: Single Stroke Pneumatic
BARREL: Rifled; FINISH: Polymer Frame; FRONT SIGHTS: Post; REAR SIGHTS: Adjustable for windage and elevation
Please refer to User Manual attached below for instructions and troubleshooting steps

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
